bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, January 15, 1954

div1.p: Hench writes Truby that they share a tendency to be perfectionists who are very sensitive to criticism, but assures Truby that he remains well respected in Washington, D. C.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, January 15, 1954
div1.opener:
January 15, 1954
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco 18, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
I fear you are like I am - a little on the hypersensitive side. I think you
and I are perfectionists and overly conscientious. We try to do our best
and when our best is not accepted and perhaps misunderstood, we tend to
feel distressed personally. I can understand your feelings with regard
to Mrs. Standlee. Her relative unwillingness to accept suggestions dis-
turbed me too but I think you should forget the matter and I doubt very
much if she has any standing in Washington which would lesson one iota
the respect which the Washington men have for you and I doubt very much
indeed if she has anything but appreciation for what you did. One can
appreciate the suggestions of others without acting upon them.

In any event, I am not being asked to Washington to talk about the yellow
fever story. I gave that several years ago. This time I have been asked
to talk on cortisone in general medicine.

I am so hopeful to locate the missing notebook in Carroll's effects; however
Mrs. Carroll, after two or three very pleasant letters, seems to be clamming
up and has not answered my last two notes requesting a definite appointment
with her. If she should let me see her husband's effects, and if the note-
book were not there, I would indeed be disappointed because that is almost
my last hope of finding it. We shall see what we shall see, and I shall
let you know at once if the notebook is found.

Keep up the good work. Doctor Treanor is most encouraging and I will send
you in due time a few leading questions regarding the yellow fever board
members. I leave next week for Colorado Springs, Kansas City and Havana,
but will be back February 1.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
